description: Number of zeros in the character table of the dihedral group with 2n elements.
links: Eric M. Schmidt, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: For odd n, a(n) = (n-1)/2.For n = 2 (mod 4), a(n) = n - 2. - _Eric M. Schmidt_, Jul 04 2012
example: a(3) = 1 because the group is isomorphic to S_3 and the table is : 1, 1, 1 1,-1, 1 2, 0,-1
prog: (Sage)def A061721(n) :....if n % 2 == 1 : return (n - 1) // 2;....if n % 4 == 2 : return n - 2;....numzeros = n - 2;....np = n // 4;....for m in xrange(1, n // 2) :........t = lcm(m, np);........if (t // np) % 2 == 1 :............maxmul = m * n // 2;............numzeros += (maxmul // t) - (maxmul // (2*t));....return numzeros;end; # _Eric M. Schmidt_, Jul 04 2012
author: Ahmed Fares (ahmedfares(AT)my-deja.com), Jun 20 2001
extensions: More terms from _Eric M. Schmidt_, Jul 04 2012
